page.title: 09Farming
page.content: The farms vary in size from crofts of a few acres to bigger units of several hundred acres.Apart from three dairy farms the farming is mixed cattle and sheep and a little arable. Suckler cows of various native breeds produce spring calves which are sold in Oct. for fattening locally or in the south. Some are retained and sold as yearlings in April. Mainly Cheviot sheep are bred.The ewes producing lambs in the spring which are sold in the autumn.Recently Suffolk tups have been introduced and the x-lambs are sold for fattening. The crops that are grown i.e.hay,oats, silage,barley and turnips are for the winter feeding of the animals. In the smaller units the crofter's main income will be from an outside occupation.
